locutie.beschrijving: The preacher explains the biblical context of Abraham's childlessness and Jeremiah's imprisonment, contrasting human hope with God's creative power.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Strong engagement with Greek nuances (par elpida) and Old Testament scholarship (Von Rad).

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the nature of God's power to create from nothing, with a shift toward promising in the conclusion.
voorbeelden: God is the One who was already there before we started searching for him.
The God who is powerful to call into existence the things that do not exist is also powerful to create hope.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To shift the hearer's reliance from their own expectations to the ontological power of God.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The sermon focuses on the Word calling faith into being, but lacks explicit invocation of the Spirit's current agency.

voorbeelden: Abraham is a hundred years old.
Jeremiah lived a life that was hopeless.
God is the One who will reveal great and hidden things.
We need a larger sense of the God.
I visit a lot of different parishes.
I will tell you great and hidden things.
The Lord will gather in the harvest.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Moderate. Most commissives are quotes of biblical promises rather than direct 'I promise you' from the pulpit.

voorbeelden: I’m going to be all right (quoted).
dominante_werkwoorden: is (as in 'The Lord is his name')
declaratieven.autoriteit: Low. The preacher describes God's declarations rather than performing them.

indicatoren: Extensive retelling of Abraham and Jeremiah's history.
Theological definitions of God's nature (3rd person).
Analysis of other people's prayers and bulletin announcements.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed about God's power but remains an observer of God's past actions.

missende_elementen: Direct address of the promise to the specific congregation
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Intellectual agreement without necessarily experiencing the 'event' of being addressed by God.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: The promises are primarily located in the biblical text quoted, not the preacher's own illocutionary act.
voorbeelden: Call to me and I will answer you.

tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used mostly to ask questions rather than deliver promises.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Abraham, Jeremiah, and God's attributes.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: High. Creates a 'lecture' feel regarding the history of redemption.

actueel_present.gebruik: Final appeal to the congregation's current hopelessness.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (God is powerful) -> Directive (We need a larger view).
voorbeelden: Our God is so small! ... We need a larger view.
foutief_patroon.probleem: Moves from a description of God to a moral/intellectual requirement for the hearer without a mediating promise.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (God creates) -> Commissive (God will create hope in you).
voorbeelden: The God who is powerful... is also powerful to create hope [in you].

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: As we grasp this hope... we learn to loosen our grip.
voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: All of that has to go. We need a larger sense...

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is a brilliant theological exposition on the nature of God's power, but it functions more as a 'talk about' God than an 'act of' God until the final paragraph.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: God is not a product of the human religious search.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The apostle Paul retells the story...
zwakke_punten.probleem: Too much time spent on the 'What' (Locution) and not enough on the 'What for' (Illocution).

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It feels like a high-quality lecture that prepares one for an event, rather than being the event itself.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher remains a witness to the text rather than a mandatory of the present Christ.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is described as the one who spoke to Jeremiah.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Low. The preacher quotes God but rarely speaks *for* God in the present tense.
tekstueel_bewijs: Listen to what God said to him.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the Word's generative power.
tekstueel_bewijs: Faith is called into being by the Word of the Lord.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon treats the Bible as a means of grace, but the sermon act itself is more pedagogical.
tekstueel_bewijs: This is the door of the divine hope.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Shift from 3rd person past (He said) to 2nd person present (He says to you).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: God had promised Abraham that he would have an heir.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: The same God who promised Abraham an heir now promises you a future beyond your dead-ends.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from historical report to present-tense commissive.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is 'out there' in the text.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use the authority of the office to deliver the promise directly.
voorbeeldzinnen: I announce to you today: God is calling life into your dead places.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Address the 'hopeless' hearer directly in the second person earlier in the sermon.
voorbeeldzinnen: You, who feel the grip of ice on your heart, hear this...

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The 'need' for a larger view is presented as a task.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Present the 'larger view' as a gift (Declarative) before calling for a response.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: Theologically profound and beautifully written, but needs more 'illocutionary fire' to move from a lecture to a sacramental event.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT reveals that the preacher isn't just 'sending a message' about hope, but is failing to use the 'Declarative' channel to actually create it.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: While rhetorically sound (good metaphors), it lacks the 'Commissives' that bind God to the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT identifies that the 'Constative Surplus' (talking about Abraham) creates a distance that prevents the sermon from being a 'creative word' in the moment.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: God is the One who was already there before we started searching for him.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High for teaching, low for encounter.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: Call to me and I will answer you.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Theological Homiletics' where the content is impeccable but the speech-act is primarily informative.
